intro: Altriarabis, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that open in the early morning and close by midday. Its leaves are typically small, heart-shaped, and adapted to reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. Altriarabis is often found growing along rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
